meanings.definition: To remove the bones from (a fish) and prepare for cooking.
meanings.sent1: She carefully fileted the fish before grilling it.
meanings.sent2: The chef expertly fileted the salmon for the dish.
meanings.sent3: After fileting the fish, she realized she forgot the seasoning!
meanings.sent4: He fileted the fish with precision, like a skilled surgeon.
meanings.sent5: The process of fileting a fish can be quite satisfying.

meanings.sent1: He enjoys fileting the fish to make it easier to cook.
meanings.sent2: The fishmonger fileted the trout for the customer.
meanings.sent3: Fileting the fish felt like solving a puzzle to her.
meanings.sent4: She fileted the fish swiftly, like a ninja with a blade.
meanings.sent5: Fileting a fish requires a sharp knife and steady hands.

meanings.definition: The act of filleting a fish.
meanings.sent1: The fileting of the fish was done with precision.
meanings.sent2: She watched the fileting of the fish with fascination.
meanings.sent3: The fileting of the fish seemed like a delicate dance.
meanings.sent4: The fileting of the fish was a work of art in itself.
meanings.sent5: The fileting of the fish left a clean and boneless fillet.
